intro: Ericoides pycnanthum, commonly known as the dwarf heath, is a low-growing evergreen shrub native to the western regions of the United States. It belongs to the Ericaceae family, which includes heathers and blueberries, and is characterized by its dense, compact growth habit. The plant features small, leathery leaves that are typically dark green and arranged in whorls around the stems. Its flowers are usually white or pale pink, appearing in clusters and blooming in late spring to early summer. Ericoides pycnanthum thrives in acidic, well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or open woodland habitats.
